Physics (Oscillations & Waves).subject: Physics (Oscillations & Waves)
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).question: The time period of a simple pendulum having a spherical wooden bob is 2 s. If the bob is replaced by a metallic one twice as heavy, the time period will be
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).explanation: Time period of a simple pendulum T = 2π√(l/g) depends on its length 'l' and acceleration due to gravity 'g' and independent of mass of the bob.

Physics (Oscillations & Waves).subject: Physics (Oscillations & Waves)
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).question: Motion of an oscillating liquid column in a U-tube is
options: simple harmonic and time period is independent of the density of the liquid
simple harmonic and time period depends on the density of the liquid
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).answer: simple harmonic and time period is independent of the density of the liquid
Physics (Oscillations & Waves).explanation: Motion of an oscillating liquid column in a U-tube is called simple harmonic motion with time period independent of on the density of the liquid.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: A liquid is kept in a regular cylindrical vessel upto a certain height. If this vessel is replaced by another cylindrical vessel having half the area of cross-section of the bottom, the pressure on the bottom will
options: be reduced to half the earlier pressure
be increased to twice the earlier pressure
be reduced to one-fourth the earlier pressure
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Pressure exerted by the fluid column depends on height (h), density ρ and acceleration due to gravity (g). P = hρg i.e. independent of area of cross-section of the vessel.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: After rising a short distance the smooth column of smoke from a cigarette breaks up into an irregular and random pattern. In a similar fashion, a stream of fluid flowing past an obstacle breaks up into eddies and vortices which give the flow irregular velocity components transverse to the flow direction. Other examples include the wakes left in water by moving ships the sound produced by whistling and by wind instruments. These examples are the results of
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Turbulent flow is accompanied by random, irregular, local circular currents called vortices.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: When ice melts, its
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: When ice melts its density increases i.e. its volume decreases. Mass is an invariant quantity.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: When deep sea fishes are brought to the surface of the sea, their bodies burst. This is because the blood in their bodies flows at very
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: When deep sea fishes are brought to the surface of the sea, their bodies burst, this is because the blood in their bodies flows at very high pressure.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Which type/types of pen uses/use capillary action in addition to gravity for flow of ink?
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Fountain pen uses capillary action in addition to gravity for flow of ink.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: By what mechanism does scent spread all over the room if the lid is opened?
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: Diffusion refers to the process by which molecules intermingle as a result of their kinetic energy of random motion.

Physics (Properties of Matter).subject: Physics (Properties of Matter)
Physics (Properties of Matter).question: Dirty cloths containing grease and oil stains are cleaned by adding detergents to water. Stains are removed because detergent
options: reduces drastically the surface tension between water and oil
increases the surface tension between water and oil
increases the viscosity of water and oil
decreases the viscosity in detergent mixed water
Physics (Properties of Matter).answer: reduces drastically the surface tension between water and oil
Physics (Properties of Matter).explanation: One end of hairpin shaped detergents attracted to water and other to molecules of oil or grease that reduces drastically the surface tension between water and oil.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: In SONAR, we use
Physics (Waves & Sound).explanation: Sonar (sound navigation and ranging) is a technique that uses sound propagation to navigate (usually under water, as in submarine navigation), communicate with or detect objects on or under the surface of the water, such as the vessels as ultrasonic waves which is used having very high frequency > 20,000 Hz.

Physics (Waves & Sound).subject: Physics (Waves & Sound)
Physics (Waves & Sound).question: Two identical piano wires have same fundamental frequency when kept under the same tension. What will happen if tension of one of the wire is slightly increased and both the wires are made to vibrate simultaneously?

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question:
Which one among the following correctly defines a unit magnetic pole in SI units?
It is the pole which when placed in air at a distance of
options: 1 foot from an equal and a similar poled repels it with a force of 1 pound
1 m from an equal and a similar pole repels it with a force of 1 N
1 cm from an equal and a similar pole repels it with a force of 1 dyne
1 metre from an equal and a similar pole repels it with a force of 1 N/m2
Physics (Electromagnetism).answer: 1 m from an equal and a similar pole repels it with a force of 1 N

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question: In step-down transformer, the AC output gives the
options: current more than the input current
current less than the input current
current equal to the input current
voltage more than the input voltage
Physics (Electromagnetism).answer: current more than the input current
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: In step-down transformer Np > Ns, Ep > Es, Ip < Is where N, E and I used for no. of turns, emf and current respectively.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Before X-ray examination (coloured X-ray) of the stomach, patients are given suitable salt of barium because
options: barium salts are white in colour and this helps stomach to appear clearly
barium is a good absorber of X-rays and helps stomach to appear clearly
barium allows X-rays to pass through the stomach
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: barium is a good absorber of X-rays and helps stomach to appear clearly
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Barium is a good absorber of X-rays and helps stomach to appear clearly.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DEXA) is used to measure
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DEXA) is used to measure the density or strength of bones.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: The main source of energy in sun is
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: The sun is the star at the centre of the solar system. It generates its energy by nuclear fusion of hydrogen nuclei into helium. H¹₂ + H¹₂ + H¹₂ ® He²₄ + H¹₁ + n⁰₁ +21.6Mev

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Which one among the following is not a correct statement?
options: Cathode rays are negatively charged particles
Cathode rays are produced from all the gases
Electrons are basic constituents of all the atoms
Hydrogen ions do not contain any proton
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: Hydrogen ions do not contain any proton
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Hydrogen ion has one proton i.e. , H¹₁. Atomic number = no. of proton =1 for atom like hydrogen.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: The best colours for a sun umbrella will be
options: black on top and red on inside
black on top and white on inside
red on top and black on inside
white on top and black on inside
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: white on top and black on inside
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: As white colour reflects all the components of white light and black colour absorbs all the components of white light. So, the best colours for a sun umbrella, white on top and black on inside.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: The gas used in a refrigerator is

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: The celsius temperature is a/an
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: The degree celsius (°C) can refer to absolute temperature.

Physics (Electronics).subject: Physics (Electronics)
Physics (Electronics).question: A rectifier is an electronic device used to convert
Physics (Electronics).explanation: A rectifier is used to convert AC voltage into DC voltage and invertor converts DC voltage into AC voltage.

Physics (Electronics).subject: Physics (Electronics)
Physics (Electronics).question: Light Emitting Diode (LED) converts
Physics (Electronics).explanation: Light Emitting Diode (LED) is semiconductor device – a forward bias p-n junction diode which converts electrical energy into light energy.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question:
Statement I: Pulling a lawn roller is easier than pushing it.
Statement II: Pushing increases the apparent weight and hence the force of friction.
options: Both the statements are true and statement II is the correct explanation of statement I
Both the statements are true, but statement II is not the correct explanation of statement I
Statement I is true, but statement II is false
Statement I is false, but statement II is true
Physics (Mechanics).answer: Both the statements are true and statement II is the correct explanation of statement I
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: It is easier to move any body by pulling it than by pushing it. A body starts to move when the applied force is more than the frictional force. This frictional force is proportional to the weight of the body under which it acts. When the lawn roller is pushed by the force (F), the vertical component of the pushing force now increases the weight (w = mg) of the roller which in turn results in increase of normal reaction and hence the friction is more.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: It is difficult to cut things with a blunt knife because
options: the pressure exerted by knife for a given force increases with increase in bluntness
a sharp edge decreases the pressure exerted by knife for a given force
a blunt knife decreases the pressure for a given force
a blunt knife decreases the area of intersection
Physics (Mechanics).answer: a blunt knife decreases the pressure for a given force
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Pressure = force/area. Bluntness of knife increases area, hence decreases the pressure for a given force.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A bus travels at a speed of 50 km/h to go from its origin of its destination at a distance of 300 km and travels at a speed of 60 km/h to return to the origin. What is the average speed of the bus?
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Average speed = total distance / total time = (300+300) / (300/50 + 300/60) = 600 / (6+5) = 600/11 = 54.55 km/h

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: Magnetic, electrostatic and gravitational forces come under the category of
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: All of these forces doesn’t need any physical contact to exist hence, non-contact forces.

Physics (Electricity).subject: Physics (Electricity)
Physics (Electricity).question: A device, which is used in our TV set, computer, radio set for storing the electric charge, is
Physics (Electricity).explanation: Capacitor (condenser) is used to store energy in an electric field. Capacitance of a capacitor C, defined as the ratio of charge ± Q on each conductor to the voltage V between them. C = Q/V

Physics (Electricity).subject: Physics (Electricity)
Physics (Electricity).question: If two conducting spheres are separately charged and then brought in contact
options: the total energy of the two spheres is conserved
the total charge on the two spheres is conserved
both the total energy and the total charge are conserved
the final potential is always the mean of the original potential of the two spheres
Physics (Electricity).answer: the total charge on the two spheres is conserved
Physics (Electricity).explanation: If two conducting spheres are separately charged and brought in contact, then the total charge on the two spheres is conserved. This is the law of conservation of charge.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Which one among the following colours has the highest wavelength?
Physics (Optics).explanation: Different colours in increasing order of their wavelength: violet, indigo, blue, green, yellow, orange and red.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Dispersion process forms spectrum due to white light falling on a prism. The light wave with shortest wavelength
options: is reflected by the side of the prism
Physics (Optics).explanation: The light wave with shortest wavelength i.e. violet refracts the most.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: A ray of white light strikes the surface of an object. If all the colours are reflected the surface would appear
Physics (Optics).explanation: When an object reflects all the colours of a white light, then it would appear white. White light is the combination of all seven colours (VIBGYOR) of light.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which element forms the highest number of compounds in the periodic table?
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation:
Carbon (C) forms a large number of compounds due to its two characteristics properties.
(i) Catenation (ability to link with other carbon atoms)
(ii) Tetra valency (valency of carbon is 4)

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: A compound that is a white solid which absorbs water vapour from the air is
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: A compound calcium sulphate (CaSO4) which is a white solid is highly hygroscopic in nature. It has a very remarkable property of setting into a hard, solid mass on wetting with water.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question: NaOH + HC1 -> NaCl + H2O in the given chemical reaction
options: sodium is oxidised and oxygen is reduced
sodium is oxidised and chlorine is reduced
None of them are oxidised or reduced
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).answer: None of them are oxidised or reduced
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation: It is a simple displacement reaction in which Hydrogen is displaced by Sodium metal, results in the formation of sodium chloride (NaCl). Also the oxidation state of each atom is same in both sides.

Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Physical Chemistry)
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).question: A liquid initially contracts when cooled down to 4°C but on further cooling down to 0°C, it expands. The liquid is
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).explanation: Water shows maximum density at 4°C. At freezing point it expands and density decreases.

Chemistry (States of Matter).subject: Chemistry (States of Matter)
Chemistry (States of Matter).question:
What are the elements which are liquids at room temperature and standard pressure?
1. Helium 2. Mercury
3. Chlorine 4. Bromine
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Chemistry (States of Matter).explanation:
Mercury (Hg), a metal is a liquid at room temperature and standard pressure.
Bromine (Br2) a non metal is a liquid at room temperature and standard pressure.

Chemistry (States of Matter).subject: Chemistry (States of Matter)
Chemistry (States of Matter).question: What type of mixture is smoke?
options: Gas mixed with a liquid and a solid
Chemistry (States of Matter).answer: Gas mixed with a liquid and a solid
Chemistry (States of Matter).explanation: Smoke is a collection of airborne solid and liquid particulates and gases emitted when a material undergoes combustion or pyrolysis, together with entrapment of liquid droplets or solid particulates in a flowing gas.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: The ultimate cause of water movement in a plant stem against gravity is
Biology (Botany).explanation: Transpiration is a process like evaporation part of the water cycle and it is the loss of water vapour from different parts of plants, particularly in leaves but also in stems, flowers and roots.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question:
Vaseline was applied to both surfaces of the leaves of a plant. Which of the following process/ processes would be affected?
1. Photosynthesis
2. Respiration
3. Transpiration
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Biology (Botany).explanation: All the above process will get stopped if vaseline is applied on both the surfaces of the leaf. Reason is that stomata will be blocked, all these processes requires the direct contact between the leaf and atmosphere.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Which one among the following statements is correct?
options: None of the enzymes is protein
None of the proteins is enzyme
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: All enzymes are proteins which catalyse various reactions occuring in cells. Therefore all enzymes are proteins, but not all proteins are enzymes.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: The pH of human blood is normally around
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation:
In chemistry, pH measures the acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution. pH is normally measured in a range of 0-14.
pH value of some common material
Material pH value
1. Sea water 8.4
2. Human blood 7.4
3. Milk 6.4
4. Human urine 6.0
5. Alcohol 2.8

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: The fossil of Archaeopteryx represents the evidence of origin of
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Archeopteryx is a genus of theropad dinosaur that is closely related to bird. It demonstrates the evidence of origin of birds from reptiles.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Which one among the following groups of animals maintains constant body temperature in changing environmental conditions?
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Birds are warm blooded animals maintaining a constant body temperature through the process of homeostasis. Fishes, amphibians and reptiles are cold blooded animals.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one among the following vitamins is necessary for blood clotting?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Vitamin K is a group of structurally similar to fat- soluble vitamins that are essential for the synthesis of certain proteins needed for blood coagulation or clotting.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: The gastrointestinal hormones namely secretin and cholecystokinin secreted by duodenal epithelium activate respectively which organs to discharge their secretions?
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Secretin and cholecystokinnin activate pancreas and gall bladder to discharge their secretions.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one among the following statements about blood transfusion is correct? Blood group B can give blood to
options: blood Group B and receive from Group AB
blood Groups B and AB and receive from Group B
blood Groups B and AB and receive from Group A
blood Group O and receive from Group B
Biology (Human Physiology).answer: blood Groups B and AB and receive from Group B
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Blood group B can provide blood to blood Groups B and AB and gets from Group B and Group’O.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: What would happen if human blood becomes acidic (low pH)?
options: Oxygen carrying capacity of haemoglobin is increased
Oxygen carrying capacity of haemoglobin is decreased
Biology (Human Physiology).answer: Oxygen carrying capacity of haemoglobin is decreased
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: If human blood becomes acidic (low pH), The amount of CO2 is increased and O2 carrying capacity of haemoglobin is reduced.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Human blood is a viscous fluid. This viscosity is due to
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Blood is a viscous fluid in human being. This viscosity is due to presence of different proteins in blood.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: In humans, which one among the following with reference to breathing is correct?
options: During inhalation, intra-pleural pressure becomes more negative
Unlike inhalation, normal exhalation is an active process
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: During inhalation, the diaphragm contracts and flattens enlarging the volume of the thoracic cavity. Thus, reduction in intra-thoracic pressure takes place.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Blood does not coagulate inside the body due to the presence of
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Heparin is an anticoagulant (blood thinner) that prevents the blood clotting. It is applied to cure and prevent blood clots in the veins, arteries, or lungs.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: The crew and passengers of a flying aircraft suffer generally from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease due to the effect of
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Due to lower atmospheric presure, N2 gets mixed with O2 to form such oxide which is inhaled by the passengers or crew.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Cancer is more common in older people because
options: the supply of certain hormones declines with age
their bodies are unable to adjust to the changing environment
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: Cancer is more common in older people because they have accumulation of more mutations.

Biology (Human Health).subject: Biology (Human Health)
Biology (Human Health).question:
Consider the following statements regarding antibiotics
1. They are used to destroy disease-causing bacteria.
2. They can be applied to the skin, swallowed or injected to fight micro-organisms inside the body.
3. They are effective against disease-causing viruses.
4. The first antibiotic to be discovered was Tetracycline.
Which of the statement(s) given above is/are correct?
Biology (Human Health).explanation: Antibiotics are very effective medicines that treat bacterial infections. They are ineffective against viral infection as viruses have different genetic makeup as compared to bacteria.

Chemistry (Gases).subject: Chemistry (Gases)
Chemistry (Gases).question: Which one among the following gases readily combines with the haemoglobin of the blood?
Chemistry (Gases).explanation: Carbon monoxide (CO) readily gets combined with the haemoglobin of the blood causing harmful effect.

Biology (Nutrition).subject: Biology (Nutrition)
Biology (Nutrition).question: A person feeds on rice and vegetable made up of potato only. He is likely to suffer from deficiency of
Biology (Nutrition).explanation: The person will suffer from deficiency of protein because potato has very little amonut of protein.

Biology (Cell Biology).subject: Biology (Cell Biology)
Biology (Cell Biology).question: Which organelle in the cell, other than nucleus, contains DNA?
Biology (Cell Biology).explanation: Mitochondrial DNA is the DNA located in organelles called mitochondria. In eukaryotic cells it converts chemical energy from food into a Adenosine Triphosphate (ATP) that cells can use.

Biology (Ecology & Environment).subject: Biology (Ecology & Environment)
Biology (Ecology & Environment).question: Which one among the following groups of items contains only biodegradable items?
Biology (Ecology & Environment).explanation: A biodegradable product gets decomposition safely and quickly, through biological process into the raw materials and disappear into the environment. Cow-dung, padddy-husk and vegetable wastes, are biodegradable products.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question: Two strands of DNA are held together by
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Two strand of DNA are held together by hydrogen- bond formed between the bases of two strand. Adenine pairs with Thymine by two Hydrogen-bond and Guanine pairs with cytosine by three Hydrogen-bond.
